etymology.description: Phonetic 尗 (shū, "wooden stake") + semantic 又 (yòu, "hand") = using a wooden stake to dig the ground -> phonetically borrowed for "paternal uncle"
etymology.interpretation: The character 叔(shū, "uncle") originally depicted using a hand to plant a wooden stake, representing construction or foundation setting. This was later phonetically borrowed to refer to a "paternal uncle" due to similar pronunciation rather than meaning.

examples.chinese: 我叔爱讲笑话(我叔愛講笑話)。
examples.english: My uncle loves to tell jokes.

examples.chinese: 我向叔讨教古典文学(我向叔討教古典文學)，他认真地分享经验(他認真地分享經驗)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiàng shū tǎojiào gǔdiǎn wénxué, tā rènzhēn de fēnxiǎng jīngyàn.
examples.english: I sought advice on classical literature from my uncle, and he seriously shared his experience.
